title: User query: Plan description from client LLM
log: Calculate the revenue loss for small-quantity orders for parts of brand ‘Brand#23’ and container type ‘MED BOX’ during the year 1996. A small order is defined as a lineitem whose quantity is less than 20% of the average quantity for that part. Compute the total gross (undiscounted) revenue of these small orders for the year 1996 and output the result in a textfile.

title: Agent: SpecifierAgent Output
log: Calculate the total gross (undiscounted) revenue of all "small-quantity" lineitems for parts whose brand is 'Brand#23' and whose container is 'MED BOX', considering only lineitems from the year 1996. Define a small-quantity lineitem as a lineitem whose quantity is less than 20% (0.20 times) of the average quantity for that same part (where the average quantity is computed across all lineitems for that part). Include only lineitems dated during the year 1996. For each qualifying small-quantity lineitem, compute its gross (undiscounted) revenue as l_extendedprice (i.e., do not apply any discounts). Sum these gross revenues to produce a single total. Write that total (a single numeric value) to a text file.

log.thoughts: The query needs part attributes (brand, container) and lineitem measures (quantity, extendedprice, shipdate, partkey). Therefore part and lineitem tables are required. No other tables or text files are needed.

steps.detailed_description: Load the 'lineitem' and 'part' tables as inputs. Keep all columns from both tables. These datasets will be the basis for subsequent aggregations, filters and joins.

From the loaded 'lineitem' table: (a) compute the average l_quantity per part key (group by l_partkey) producing a dataset avg_qty_per_part with columns (l_partkey, avg_quantity); (b) filter the original lineitem rows to retain only rows with l_shipdate between '1996-01-01' and '1996-12-31' (inclusive), producing filtered_lineitem_1996. Output both datasets (avg_qty_per_part and filtered_lineitem_1996) for downstream joins.

Join the filtered_lineitem_1996 (from step 2) with avg_qty_per_part (from step 2) on l_partkey = l_partkey to attach avg_quantity to each 1996 lineitem; then join the resulting dataset with 'part' (from step 1) on l_partkey = p_partkey to attach part attributes. After the joins, filter rows to keep only those where p_brand = 'Brand#23' AND p_container = 'MED BOX' AND l_quantity < 0.20 * avg_quantity. For each remaining row, retain l_extendedprice. Output the qualifying small-quantity lineitems with their l_extendedprice.

Sum the l_extendedprice values from the qualifying small-quantity lineitems produced in step 3 to compute a single numeric total_gross_revenue (note: do not apply l_discount). Write this single numeric value to the requested text file as the final output.

log.thoughts: I load both tables, compute per-part average quantities and filter lineitems to 1996, then join to attach averages and part attributes and apply the small-quantity and part filters. Finally I aggregate the l_extendedprice values and write the single total to a text file.

title: Class: StepHandler created step dependencies and queue

operations.table: (SELECT l_orderkey, l_partkey, l_suppkey, l_linenumber, l_quantity, l_extendedprice, l_discount, l_tax, l_returnflag, l_linestatus, l_shipdate, l_commitdate, l_receiptdate, l_shipinstruct, l_shipmode, l_comment FROM lineitem) as X

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { ( r.getField(0).asInstanceOf[Int], r.getField(1).asInstanceOf[Int], r.getField(2).asInstanceOf[Int], r.getField(3).asInstanceOf[Int], r.getField(4), r.getField(5), r.getField(6), r.getField(7), r.getField(8).toString, r.getField(9).toString, r.getField(10), r.getField(11), r.getField(12), r.getField(13).toString, r.getField(14).toString, r.getField(15).toString ) }

operations.table: (SELECT p_partkey, p_name, p_mfgr, p_brand, p_type, p_size, p_container, p_retailprice, p_comment FROM part) as X

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { ( r.getField(0).asInstanceOf[Int], r.getField(1).toString, r.getField(2).toString, r.getField(3).toString, r.getField(4).toString, r.getField(5).asInstanceOf[Int], r.getField(6).toString, r.getField(7), r.getField(8).toString ) }

log.thoughts: Load both tables via jdbcRemoteInput and map each Record to a Scala tuple containing all columns so downstream steps can consume structured rows. IDs start at 1 and are consecutive.

operations.table: (SELECT l_orderkey, l_partkey, l_suppkey, l_linenumber, l_quantity, l_extendedprice, l_discount, l_tax, l_returnflag, l_linestatus, l_shipdate, l_commitdate, l_receiptdate, l_shipinstruct, l_shipmode, l_comment FROM lineitem) as X

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val part = r.getField(1).asInstanceOf[Int]; val qty = try { r.getField(4).toString.toDouble } catch { case _: Throwable => 0.0 }; (part, (qty, 1)) }
(t: (Int, (Double, Int))) => { val part = t._1; val sumQty = t._2._1; val cnt = t._2._2; val avg = if (cnt == 0) 0.0 else sumQty / cnt; (part, avg) }
(r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val sd = r.getField(10).toString; sd >= "1996-01-01" && sd <= "1996-12-31" }

operations.table: (SELECT p_partkey, p_name, p_mfgr, p_brand, p_type, p_size, p_container, p_retailprice, p_comment FROM part) as X

log.thoughts: Load both tables; compute avg quantity per part by mapping quantities to (part,(qty,1)), reducing by key, then mapping to average. Also filter lineitem by shipdate within 1996. Expose avg and filtered datasets as outputs (operators 4 and 5) and keep part input (6) for downstream joins.

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val partkey = r.getField(1).asInstanceOf[Int]; val qty = r.getField(4).asInstanceOf[Number].doubleValue(); (partkey, (qty, 1)) }
(t: (Int, (Double, Int))) => { val partkey = t._1; val sum = t._2._1; val cnt = t._2._2; val avg = if (cnt == 0) 0.0 else sum / cnt; (partkey, avg) }
(r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val sd = r.getField(10).toString; sd >= "1996-01-01" && sd <= "1996-12-31" }
(r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => (r.getField(0).asInstanceOf[Int], r.getField(3).toString, r.getField(6).toString)

(t: ((org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, (Int, Double)), (Int, String, String))) => { val r = t._1._1; val avg = t._1._2._2; val brand = t._2._2; val container = t._2._3; val qty = r.getField(4).asInstanceOf[Number].doubleValue(); brand == "Brand#23" && container == "MED BOX" && qty < 0.2 * avg }
(t: ((org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, (Int, Double)), (Int, String, String))) => t._1._1.getField(5)

log.thoughts: Load lineitem and part via JDBC, compute avg qty per part (map->reduceBy->map), filter lineitems for 1996, join filtered lineitems with avg qty and then with part attributes, filter by brand/container/quantity condition, and output l_extendedprice.

operations.table: (SELECT l_orderkey, l_partkey, l_suppkey, l_linenumber, l_quantity, l_extendedprice, l_discount, l_tax, l_returnflag, l_linestatus, l_shipdate, l_commitdate, l_receiptdate, l_shipinstruct, l_shipmode, l_comment FROM lineitem) as X

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val part = r.getField(1).asInstanceOf[Int]; val qty = r.getField(4).asInstanceOf[java.math.BigDecimal].doubleValue(); (part, (qty, 1)) }

(r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val d = r.getField(10).toString; val date = java.sql.Date.valueOf(d); val from = java.sql.Date.valueOf("1996-01-01"); val to = java.sql.Date.valueOf("1996-12-31"); !date.before(from) && !date.after(to) }
(t: (Int, (Double, Int))) => { val part = t._1; val sum = t._2._1; val cnt = t._2._2; val avg = if (cnt == 0) 0.0 else sum / cnt; (part, avg) }

operations.table: (SELECT p_partkey, p_name, p_mfgr, p_brand, p_type, p_size, p_container, p_retailprice, p_comment FROM part) as X

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => (r.getField(0).asInstanceOf[Int], r.getField(3).toString, r.getField(6).toString)

(t: ((org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, (Int, Double)), (Int, String, String))) => { val rec = t._1._1; val avg = t._1._2._2; val l_qty = rec.getField(4).asInstanceOf[java.math.BigDecimal].doubleValue(); val p_brand = t._2._2; val p_container = t._2._3; (p_brand == "Brand#23") && (p_container == "MED BOX") && (l_qty < 0.2 * avg) }
(t: ((org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, (Int, Double)), (Int, String, String))) => t._1._1.getField(5).asInstanceOf[java.math.BigDecimal].doubleValue()
(a: Double, b: Double) => a + b

log.thoughts: Loaded both JDBC tables, computed avg quantity per part (map->reduceBy->map), filtered 1996 lineitems, joined to attach avg and part info, filtered by brand/container/quantity threshold, extracted l_extendedprice and reduced to single sum, wrote to text output.

log.thoughts: Fixed duplicate and out-of-order IDs, ensured a clear DAG: computed per-part average quantity (reduceBy->map), filtered lineitems to 1996, joined filtered lineitems with averages then with part info, applied brand/container and small-quantity filter, mapped to l_extendedprice and reduced to a single sum. Corrected final reduce output wiring and added output operator.

title: Class: PlanMapper Mapped the refined plan finalized for execution
